alert.note: Alert for Dale (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 29 at 4:30PM CDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northern Dale and northwestern Henry Counties through 515 PM CDT... At 429 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Blue Springs State Park to near Ozark. Movement was northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Ozark, Fort Rucker, Ariton, Bells Crossroads, Skipperville, Dill, Dean Church Road, Hooper Stage Field, Edwin, Roberts Crossroads, Mabson, Arguta, Snells Crossroads, Barefield Crossroads, Beamon, Dale County Lake, Clopton, Marley Hill, Blackwell Field A/p and Dillard. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
